Half-Life 2:Episode One is Valve's dissapointing but acceptable name for the sequel to their masterpiece; Half-Life 2. Made in 2005, everyone who played and beat Half-Life 2 was hungry for more story after finishing Half-Life 2. Valve released this "semi-filler" since it was short and not much story was to the game but it was important to the storyline. It also comes with Half-Life 2 deathmatch; a multiplayer Half-Life which is already dead since Valve doesn't support the game anymore, and skill ceiling is higher than most multiplayer games. Half-Life 2:Episode One's story is about our silent protaganist; Gordon Freeman and his friends and followers escaping the about to explode citidale which I won't spoil for you. 

Since the game was made in 2005, most computers these days should be able to play the game without much difficulty, gameplay is still the same from Half-Life 2 which the main difference is the storyline. The achievements are fair and simple to accomplish if you are dedicated to get them so achievment hunters are welcomed to play. Over all, I recommend Half-Life 2:Episode One to people who love the Half-Life series, love classic games, have low-quality computers, want unique gameplay, are achievement hunters, have a bit of money over a large sale, and love FPS genre of games etc.
Way shorter than the other games but still a good story. Get it and episode 2 if you want to continue the story after Half Life 2.

Episodio 1 riprende esattamente da dove ci aveva lasciati HL2, facendoci proseguire nella storia e portando nuovi ed interessanti elementi di trama. Inoltre in questo DLC troviamo l'aggiunta di un nuova tipologia di nemico e puzzles riguardante le formicaleone. Peccato solo per la durata, ( 4 ore di gioco) che però è proporzionale al costo dell'espensione.

Great! A bit short, but very story-rich and with a focus around Alyx Vance. It also makes more use of the Zero Point Energy Field Manipulator (or gravity gun) that I felt was a bit underused in the original HL2. Overall, it's a great prelude to hl2ep2 that also functions as a sort of "GravGun training". It also features the return of the all-powerful [spoiler] Super gravity gun [spoiler] which as we all know, was a fun bit of playing god.

Decently good, but can be boring at times. Unfortunately slow start (especially for following up on Half Life 2), but picks up pretty soon. Alyx is great, the soundtrack is enjoyable, and the gameplay is as always varied and viscerally fun.

Итак, начнем обзор с того, что Гордон похож на Уолтера Уайта. Хочется сказать, что единственный минус это короткий эпизод, но насыщенный. А теперь плюсы. Во-первых это продолжение сюжета Халф Лайф 2 с того момента как мы взорвали ядро. Во-вторых новые npc. В-третьих новые локации, Сити-17 и весь Цитадель превратились в гору камней и металла. И в-четвертых этот эпизод как и Халф Лайф 2 закончился эпично. Я покупал Халф Лайф 2 и подумывал скачать пиратку 1 и 2-го эпизода, но я все-таки захотел купить, такие проекты заслуживают быть только купленными.

Wow... that was.. not good.  I know this review is untimely as heck, as are most of mine, but what the heck happened between HL2 and HL2E1.  

First of all, who came up with the idiotic naming convention?  Wouldn't Half Life 2: Episode 1 be the first episode of Half Life 2?  Rather than some sequel to it?  I'm sure that's not a particularly fresh observation, but I honestly have no idea what people want when they beg for Half Life 3 to come into existence.  Half Life 2: Episode 3?  Based on current naming conventions, if the next game was significant enough to be an actual sequal to Half Life 2 and the episodes, I imagine that game would be called something like Half Life 2: Episode 2: Episode 1.

Alright, on to actual problems with the game!  

-I absolutely hate it when I pick up a new weapon and it automatically replaces the weapon in my hand.  This happened with a grenade while I was merrily firing my shotgun and because of that I accidently threw the grenade and blew myself up.

-Support character is an idiot.  It's hard to tatically advance backwards (AKA retreat) when she's standing in the doorway.  Her other sins include dying and making me restart the section as opposed to fist bump whoever killed her.

-Not a single new enemy or idea since HL2.  HL2 was almost as much puzzle as it was shooter.  This game was Call of Duty with even worse enemy AI.

-Weapon placement was haphazard.  This feels like a weird complaint, but HL2 and even HL1 excelled in this area.  The grenade story above is a good example.  I believe HL2 introduced grenades to deal with enemy snipers holed up in windows.  In this case it was just in some random room, no different than all the other samey rooms I've already been through.  The first time I got a rocket launcher is another example.  It was quite some time before I used the dang thing.  And of course I used it to fight one of those lobster space ships that I've shot down a thousand times now.

-Excessively linear compared to HL2.

-Not a whole lot going on in the story department.  I feel like it could be safely skipped and you'll still understand this mythical HL3 thing that supposedly may someday happen.  I haven't played it yet, but if it follows the pattern established by this game I imagine all that happens in HL2E2 is Gordon and what's her face make trip to Wal-Mart.

-Length.  I know it was made to be episodic before Valve abandoned it after episode 2, but the game being this short just means I had all of these problems jam packed into 4 hours.

Overall, this really feels like a game that could have been thrown together over the weekend with Valves B-Team considering they didn't have to create a single new asset.

episode 1 bana göre serinin en zayıf oyunudur.nedeni :
oyunda alyx denilen bir tür yaratıkla oynamak zorundasınız ve harita bunun için tasarlanmamış.ve bu durum göze çok batıyo oyundan soğutuyo ve aksiyonu düşürüyor.alyx sizi sürekli blockluyor adam akıllı haraket edemiyorsunuz bile çünkü oyunun lvl dizaynı dar alan ağırlıklı.örneğin 3. bölümdesiniz koridorlardan geçiyorsunuz.poison headcraplar büyük bir odanın küçük kapısının yan tarafında bekliyor.zaten o yaratığın huyu o kuytu köşelerde saklanmak.yan taraflara baka baka gidiyorsunuz gördünüz o yaratığı hemen geri dönüp pozisyon alıp öldürüceksiniz.ama alyx sizi blockluyo ve o yaratıktan damage yemek zorunda kalıyorsunuz ve o yaratık canınızı direk 1 e düşürüyo yani 2. bir saldırı veya diğer canavarlardan herhangi bir saldırı sizi direk öldürücek.bu oyunun en büyük hatasıdır ve 1 veya 2 defa başınıza gelmiyo hep blockluyo hep.
half life 2 de de aynı muhabbet vardı ve son bölümlerde beni kanser ediyordu striderlarla savaşıyorum oçun biri geliyo beni blockluyo ve ölüyorum.çok şükür episode 2 de durumu anladılar ve alyx yanınızda olmuyor bi yerde bekliyo genellikle.
onun dışında güzel bir oyun fakat bu "fatal flaw" oyunu oynamayı güçleştiriyor.ayrıca text in yarısı oyunda gözükmüyo bile bide su altında bir glitch var onuda çözersiniz internette var çözümü ben nasıl çözdüğümü hatırlamıyorum ama bulursunuz siz.

The continuing chapter of Half Life 2, and the climax of the trilogy as Alyx and Gordon attempt to escape a dying City 17 while the Combine gives chase and tries to use the collapsing Citadel to take out the resistance. 

Technically its more impressive than the base HL2 as it has a more advanced AI for Alyx, better facial animation, improved lighting and models, though its a bit shorter in length and can probably be completed in a few hours. Still a legendary classic nevertheless.
